intro: Geniosporum madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are often pale blue or purple in color. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
